title: Paleo Steak & Roasted Brussels
description: A simple, high-protein paleo dinner featuring pan-seared steak finished with herb garlic butter and oven-roasted Brussels sprouts caramelized with a touch of balsamic. Bold, savory steak flavors meet sweet-tangy, crispy Brussels for a hearty low-carb meal.

ingredients.display_name: boneless ribeye or sirloin steak (about 1 to 1¼ inch thick)
ingredients.notes: trim excess fat, bring to room temperature

ingredients.display_name: ghee or clarified butter (for paleo; use grass-fed butter if not strict)

ingredients.notes: zest for butter, juice for finishing sprouts

steps.text: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with foil or parchment and arrange a rack if you have one.

Prepare Brussels sprouts: trim stems and halve. Toss in a bowl with half the olive oil, half the minced garlic, 1 tsp coarse salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, and the balsamic vinegar until evenly coated. Spread cut-side down on the prepared baking sheet in a single layer.

Roast the Brussels sprouts in the preheated oven for 18 minutes, then flip or shake the pan and roast until deeply browned and crisp at the edges, about 7-10 more minutes depending on size. Total roast time about 25-28 minutes.

While sprouts roast, season the steak generously on both sides with the remaining salt and pepper. Pat dry to ensure good sear. Heat a heavy skillet (cast iron preferred) over high heat until very hot.

Add 1 tbsp olive oil to the hot skillet, then add the steak. Sear without moving for 3-4 minutes to develop a deep crust. Flip and sear the other side 3-4 minutes for medium-rare (internal temps: 125-130°F). Adjust time for thicker cuts or desired doneness.

During the last 1-2 minutes of cooking, reduce heat to medium-low, add the remaining ghee, minced garlic, thyme leaves, and lemon zest to the pan. Tilt the pan and spoon the melted herb-garlic butter over the steak repeatedly to baste and flavor the meat.
Transfer the steak to a cutting board, tent loosely with foil and rest for 6-8 minutes to allow juices to redistribute.

Finish roasted Brussels: remove from oven, taste and adjust seasoning with remaining salt/pepper and a squeeze of lemon juice if using. Toss with chopped rosemary and optional red pepper flakes for heat.
Slice the steak against the grain into thin slices, spoon any reserved pan juices or butter over top, and serve alongside the roasted Brussels sprouts.
